Record.Value: Construction
Building bases for the ODA starts with understanding the basics of construction.
Practical Training: Stage II
Hello, Cadet. You've demonstrated essential Stationeer skills, now it's time to put them to work. Stationeers are builders, above all else. Let's test your basic construction abilities.
Collect screwdriver, place in tool belt.
Equip angle grinder in either hand.
Collect drill, place in tool belt.
Practical Training: Stage II.
Without tools, a Stationeer is defenseless against the hostile universe. Go to the crate and pick up your tools, before something terrible happens.
In this ODA training simulation, the walls were 'damaged' by a meteor shower. To replace them, you must first remove the damaged frames using an angle grinder.
Deconstruction
Remove Destroyed frame 1.
Remove Destroyed frame 2.
Construction
Make sure this base is tidy for the next Cadet - finish constructing the base walls. Start with iron frames.
Build frame in highlighted location.
Complete frames with iron sheets + welder in active hand.
Deconstruction Of The Autolathe.

Precision and planning are essential Stationeer skills. The last Cadet was ejected from the program for building the autolathe in the wrong place. Deconstruct it piece by piece, then rebuild it in the correct position.
Deconstruct stage 5 of autolathe with drill.
Deconstruct stage 4 of autolathe with angle grinder.
Deconstruct stage 3 of autolathe with wire cutters.
Deconstruct stage 2 of autolathe with angle grinder.
Deconstruct stage I of autolathe with wrench.
Construction Of The Autolathe.
You've got everything you need to rebuild the autolathe in the correct, highlighted position. So you should do that. Now.
Place the autolathe kit.
Build stage 2 of autolathe with welder + iron sheets
Build stage 3 of autolathe with cable coil
Build stage 4 of autolathe with welder + plastic sheets
Build stage 5 of autolathe with screwdriver
Damanged Wire Removal.
Without power, you can't fabricate much. To power up the station, you need to reconnect the solar panels to the network. Start by removing the damaged cables.
Remove damaged cable #1 with wire cutters
Remove damaged cable #2 with wire cutters
Remove damaged cable #3 with wire cutters
Cable Placement.

Designing power networks is a central part of base construction. Connect the solar panels to the power network using cables from the crate. Like many kits, cables offer several options to scroll through.
Replace missing Heavy straight cable.
Replace missing Heavy junction cable.
Replace missing Heavy straight cable #2.
Backup Power.
You're not finished yet, Cadet! It gets dark sometimes, so let's create a backup power system, using a solid fuel generator.
You'll need to connect the generator to the power network.
Overlay Junction
Use the 'overlay' function to link new cables to an existing network.
Get solid fuel generator kit from crate
Place solid fuel generator
Use wirecutters and cable to create a junction.
Powering Up
Area Power Controllers separate out power and data into sub-networks, stabilize your electrical flow, and provide back up power. Just be careful which way round you install them.
Get Area Power Controller (APC) from crate.
Place APC in highlighted position with correct orientation.
Now start the generator using coal found in the crate.
The APC also charges batteries, which is good: the ODA recommends keeping several charged batteries to hand at all time. In an outage, the battery will provide back-up power briefly, too.
Get battery from crate
Open APC with crowbar.
Get coal from crate
Add coal to generator
Turn generator on
Add battery to APC
Well done, you have completed the power network. You did better than the last Cadet. Turn on the APC to activate the network, and let there be LIGHT.
More information can be found in the Stationpedia. Press F1 to refresh your knowledge of the APC, by consulting the entry in the Stationpedia.
Turn on APC.
Open Stationpedia
Navigate to Area Power Control page.
Close Stationpedia
Complete.

Good work, Cadet. You've repaired the walls and finished a power system. That's the last step of Phase II. Press the 'Complete' button to transmit your results to Stationeer Command, and we'll move on.
Press button to complete test.
Get Heavy Cable from Crate.
Get Iron Frames from Crate.
Get Iron Sheets from Crate.
